New Delhi Diselimuti Asap Beracun, Politisi India Saling Lempar Kesalahan
03 Nov 2019, 17:02 by Rakhmad Hidayatulloh Permana
New Delhi - Ibu kota India, New Delhi diselubungi kabut asap tebal yang beracun. Asap ini pun menimbulkan banyak masalah di New Delhi. Para politisi India pun saling lempar kesalahan terkait hal ini.
Sebagaimana dilansir kantor berita AFP pada Minggu (3/11/2019), New Delhi diselimuti kabut asap beracun selama beberapa hari terakhir ini. Bahkan, efek asap telah membuat kualitas udara di New Delhi menjadi yang terburuk dalam beberapa tahun terakhir.
Kabut asap juga menyebabkan beberapa jadwal penerbangan pesawat dialihkan dan ditunda. Para politisi India pun salah menyalahkan lantaran masalah polusi asap gagal diatasi.
Konsentrasi partikel beracun berukuran kurang dari 2,5 mikron mencapai tingkat tertinggi musim ini. Menurut BMKG India, hal ini semakin diperburuk oleh hujan ringan Sabtu (2/11) malam lalu. Bahkan menurut kedutaan AS di New Delhi, polutan di atmosfer sudah mencapai 810 mikrogram per meter kubik pada Minggu pagi dan masuk zona 'berbahaya'.
Situasi udara yang memburuk di New Delhi ini dibenarkan oleh Kepala Menteri New Delhi Arvind Kejriwal. "Polusi telah mencapai tingkat yang tak tertahankan," kata Arvind Kejriwal melalui twitnya, Minggu (3/11).
Dalam sebuah twit sebelumnya, Kejriwal juga meminta pemerintah negara bagian Punjab dan Haryana yang bertetangga untuk mengambil tindakan.
"Delhi telah berubah menjadi kamar gas karena asap dari tunggul tanaman yang terbakar di negara-negara tetangga," twitnya.
Sementara itu, Menteri Lingkungan Federal Prakash Javadekar justru menuduh Kejriwal mempolitisasi masalah ini.

New Delhi Shrouded in Toxic Smoke, Indian Politicians Throw Mistakes
03 Nov 2019, 17:02 by Rakhmad Hidayatulloh Permana
New Delhi - The capital of India, New Delhi is enveloped in a thick, haze of poison. This smoke also causes many problems in New Delhi. Indian politicians also throw blame on this matter.
As reported by the AFP news agency on Sunday (3/11/2019), New Delhi has been blanketed in a haze of poison over the past few days. In fact, the smoke effect has made the air quality in New Delhi the worst in recent years.
Haze also caused some flight schedules to be diverted and delayed. Indian politicians also wrongly blame because the problem of smoke pollution failed to overcome.
Concentrations of toxic particles smaller than 2.5 microns have reached the highest level this season. According to Indian BMKG, this was made worse by light rain last Saturday (2/11) last night. Even according to the US embassy in New Delhi, pollutants in the atmosphere had reached 810 micrograms per cubic meter on Sunday morning and entered the 'dangerous' zone.
The worsening air situation in New Delhi was confirmed by New Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal. "Pollution has reached unbearable levels," Arvind Kejriwal said through his tweet, Sunday (3/11).
In an earlier tweet, Kejriwal also asked neighboring Punjab and Haryana state governments to take action.
"Delhi has been turned into a gas chamber because of smoke from burning plant stumps in neighboring countries," he tweeted.
Meanwhile, Federal Environment Minister Prakash Javadekar actually accused Kejriwal of politicizing the issue.
